intro: Sylitra contorta, commonly known as the twisted sylitra, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as mint and lavender. The plant is characterized by its slender, twisting stems and small, opposite leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are typically tubular and arranged in whorls, producing nectar that attracts various pollinators. Sylitra contorta is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
